job_title: Student Nurse Technician in Victoria, TX
pros: You either love or hate the staff you work with.
cons: Understaffing. Unfair to nurses. Lack priorities for patient acuity.

pros: Great hours. Great people. Difficult patients
Always opportunities to pick up extra hours
cons: Management has favorites, seniority takes precedence, some shifts are understaff, full female staff ( internal drama).

pros: my colleagues are the only good thing
cons: this is a shady employer who does not care about nurses

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Houston, TX

review_title: Not a great place to work
job_title: Acute Care Nurse Practitioner in Victoria, TX
pros: Close to home, and love the doctors
cons: Do not take care of their employees

pros: Co-nurses are friendly and will try to offer help at times. It's good place to gain experience since it's very busy almost every shift.
cons: Staffing is very bad. They burn out nurses. The nurse-patient ratio is not safe for the patients. Nurses do all the work from bathing, changing diapers, changing beds, collecting food trays and garbages. Nurse Assistants barely help with attending patients call bell even if primary nurse is still attending other patient.

job_title: Phlebotomist and Laboratory Assistant in Victoria, TX
pros: In the 15 years I was employed, the hospital grew exponentially. I worked the night shift from 8pm-7am 7 days on-7days off. I loved it, covering 5 floors, Outpatient and ER and ICU. I learned to assist the one technologist I was assigned on centrifuging, loading chemistry and hematology samples, staining slides, planting cultures in microbiology, etc.
cons: It got so busy covering two hospitals. Always running, no set breaks, having to be in5 places at one time; all the time. Having to give up time off to replace someone sick or incapacitated.

review_title: Join if you prefer to be disengaged
pros: Teamwork among colleagues is great. If you're starting out as a new nurse here, there is definitely a lot you can learn. Beyond that, there are no other pros.
cons: Management is horribly disconnected with staff and is authoritarian in nature. Attrition rate is higher than average. The board focuses too much on investing in infrastructure and too little on their employees. Instead of offering greater work-life balance at a higher pay, this place works you like a dog. No manager has shown any regard toward the professional development of their employees. Pay is low and haggling a raise out of HR is almost pointless. This place is a terrible place to work!

pros:
Set schedule 
One of the best options within Victoria (not too many options) 
Great place to learn a lot quickly
cons:
Frequently short staffed 
1:6 patient ratios with one or no aide 
Management doesn’t help with hands on care EVER

review_title: I LOVED my job AND WOULD STILL BE VERY HAPPILY WORKING THERE, but a co worker and dept head made it impossible to stay!
job_title: Central Sterile Technician in Victoria, TX
pros: If you love working in healthcare and are rewarded by the feeling of helping others, any healthcare job will be rewarding!!
cons:
I had a co worker that was threatening physical violence towards me ( I'm a totally disabled person trying to supplement my income.) When I brought these threats to the department head, I was told I was acting like a 12 yr old, and she would not listen to my fears! I was ordered out of her office!
Later that day, two co workers were heard by myself and another person ( from a different department) making plans to "have me jumped" at night when I left work after dark.

I worked at Detar and North W9omens Hospital My last pay period had @200 hours for a two week period.  I didn't mind working..i LOVED my job and was very good at it!
But having a very severe condition from a previous accident ment certain paralysis or death should I be attacked !!

My immediate supervisor was "friends" with this woman outside of the hospital.  I was treated unfairly with my concerns and for my own safety, felt that due to the seriousness of these threats and the total lack of support that I received from our supervisor/head of the department....I had no alternative  but to resign that day with no advanced notice.
I miss my job, but my physical safety comes first!!!  

As far as I know these women still work in this department.

review_title: I've never had a check bounce
pros: Solid, professional middle management. The chief nursing officer Heidi is a thoughtful, compassionate person. Clean facilities. Mostly friendly staff.
cons: Overworked. Staff patient ratios consistently 6:1 with one or no aid. Several charge nurses are rude and wear it like a badge of honor.

pros: Detar is a very good place to work and the employees are just as awesome and friendly.
cons: The hours were long some times but that was the position

review_title: Fast-paced and challenging on med-surg. Great experience

Supportive upper management
Competitive pay with other hospitals in area
cons:

poor staffing at times made for stressful environment

job_title: Direct Support Professional in Victoria, TX
pros: Benefits, great coworkers, good food available to staff
cons: Never assume you are getting the full truth about future plans of the company and your place in it.

job_title: RN Staff Nurse in Victoria, TX
pros: Great benefits. Fair pay. Upgraded floors, be ER, and will be building new ICU unut.
cons: Can't make up their minds with staffing ratio and havung night aides, cancelled Christmas party,
Rules and regulations tend to hinder perfection.

pros: The working area was nice and clean.
cons: Co-workers did not offer friendly workplace.  They do not go out of their way to make you feel part of team.
